author: Brett Williams
description: The Facebook family is finally all together.
title: Facebook's new notifications bundle Instagram and Messenger together

author: Kurt Wagner
description: The new partnership is Facebook’s biggest foray yet into live sports.
title: Facebook will stream 20 MLB games for free this season

author: Reuters
description: The fine is over Facebook's ability to match user identities
title: EU Fines Facebook $122 Million For ‘Misleading Information’ in Its WhatsApp Deal

author: Colin  Daileda
description: In France and the Netherlands, Facebook is allegedly violating user privacy.
title: European nations fine Facebook over being cagey with users' data

author: Mike Shields
description: Google, Amazon and Facebook all see an opportunity to disrupt TV advertising. Among the three tech giants, Facebook has perhaps chosen the toughest route.
title: Facebook's plan to disrupt TV advertising may have hit a wall

author: Sebastian Anthony
description: Facebook says it couldn't automatically match WhatsApp accounts; EC disagrees.
title: Facebook fined $122 million for misleading EU over WhatsApp deal

author: Rani Molla and Kurt Wagner
description: It didn’t happen fast, but Facebook’s business has taken off.
title: Facebook’s meteoric five-year climb as a public company in five charts

author: Mathew Ingram
description: The latest mistake feeds right into the TV industry's argument that Facebook is not to be trusted.
title: Facebook’s Latest Ad Measurement Error Comes at the Worst Possible Time

author: Denis Campbell
description: Poll of 14- to 24-year-olds shows Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat and Twitter increased feelings of inadequacy and anxiety
title: Facebook and Twitter 'harm young people's mental health'

author: John Shinal
description: The fines EU regulators have levied on Facebook this month are worth about four days profit -- or 4 cents a share
title: Facebook bulls need to watch out for European regulators
